channel.title: Comments on: Notes and Domino 8.5.1 – The Upgrader’s Guide – Review

item.title: By: Mark Myers
item.dc:creator: Mark Myers
item.description: <p>to me (even as a safari subscription holder) the time of full on development books are dead except for those platforms where people want to start from scratch (java .net, adobe etc etc) and as i have not found a single completely new notes developer the target audience is not there, if your already in you tend to have specific questions and the net answers them best</p>
item.content:encoded: to me (even as a safari subscription holder) the time of full on development books are dead except for those platforms where people want to start from scratch (java .net, adobe etc etc) and as i have not found a single completely new notes developer the target audience is not there, if your already in you tend to have specific questions and the net answers them best

item.title: By: Matt White
item.dc:creator: Matt White
item.description: <p>Ulrich,</p><p>All of my efforts are devoted to <a href="http://xpages101.net"/ rel="nofollow ugc">xpages101</a> at the moment. And it wouldn't surprise me if there were better qualified people than already writing a book.</p><p>Too many things to do, too little time. :-)</p><p>Matt</p>
item.content:encoded:
Ulrich,

All of my efforts are devoted to xpages101 at the moment. And it wouldn’t surprise me if there were better qualified people than already writing a book.

Too many things to do, too little time. ðŸ™‚

Matt

item.title: By: Ulrich Krause
item.dc:creator: Ulrich Krause
item.description: <p>>> Now if there was an XPages Bible in the style of Brian and Rocky's book ...<br/>When can we expect one from YOU ?? :-) Declan Lynch as co-Author?</p>
item.content:encoded:
